Text: @suzie_sze @GeekTrader @BillBrennansays Here's a Question for all ‘White People', including me. What would you do ? And why does President Trump not condemn Racism and Hatred.  https://t.co/ouTbuHKcpN

I've helped organise a couple of events for @CIPR_UK @LondonPR on 9 ; 16 June 2020. They're an opportunity to hear best practice #PR and #Comms responses to #COVID19. Series is titled #Coronacon. Ticket sale proceeds to @IprovisionC ; @felixprojectuk https://t.co/J73o8GAOGP

Our country allows for peaceful protests, but there is no reason for violence. I've seen our citizens unify ; take care of one another through COVID19 ; we can't stop now. My deepest condolences to the family of George Floyd. As a nation, let's focus on peace, prayers ; healing.

DEADLINE EXTENSION: The submission deadline has been pushed back 48 hours (now June 3rd, 23:59 UTC-12) to allow people affected by recent civil unrest and Covid19-related lockdowns some additional time to finalise their papers.

We have now watched an armed attack, instigated by the president of the United States, on peaceful, law-abiding demonstrators exercising their Constitutional rights. All of Trump's actions and words have etched today as a grim moment in American history.

As Donald Trump poses on the steps of a church holding a Bible, Christians everywhere try to recall the bit where it advocates using tear gas on peaceful protestors for a photo op.

Donald Trump used our tax dollars to tear gas American cirizens who were peacefully protesting, so that he and his gaggle of devoted white men could walk to a closed church for a photo op holding a bible.
